article_title: EU Top Court Strikes Down Data-Retention Law
article_text:
BRUSSELS—The European Union's highest court on Tuesday struck down the bloc's data-retention law, dealing a blow to law-enforcement authorities that claim they need easy access to telecommunications data to fight organized crime and terrorism.

The ruling by the European Court of Justice also creates uncertainty for telecom providers in the EU, who have been collecting and storing user data since the 2006 law was enacted.

article_summary:
The ruling by the European Court of Justice also creates uncertainty for telecom providers in the EU, who have been collecting and storing user data since the 2006 law was enacted.
BRUSSELS—The European Union's highest court on Tuesday struck down the bloc's data-retention law, dealing a blow to law-enforcement authorities that claim they need easy access to telecommunications data to fight organized crime and terrorism.
